sentences.chinese: 高祖所教歌兒百二十人，皆令為吹樂，後有缺，輒補之。
sentences.literal: The one hundred twenty boys Gao Zu had taught to sing were all ordered to perform music; when later there were vacancies, they would always fill them.
sentences.idiomatic: The 120 boys Gaozu had taught to sing were all assigned to perform music. When vacancies occurred later, they were always filled.

sentences.chinese: 高帝八男：長庶齊悼惠王肥；
sentences.literal: The High Emperor had eight sons: the eldest, Concubine-born King Dao Hui of Qi, Fei;
sentences.idiomatic: The High Emperor had eight sons: the eldest by a concubine was King Daohui of Qi, Fei;

sentences.literal: next Emperor Xiaohui, son of Empress Lü;
sentences.idiomatic: next was Emperor Xiaohui, son of Empress Lü;

sentences.chinese: 次戚夫人子趙隱王如意；
sentences.literal: next Consort Qi's son King Yin of Zhao, Ruyi;
sentences.idiomatic: next was Consort Qi's son, King Yin of Zhao, Ruyi;

sentences.chinese: 次代王恒，已立為孝文帝，薄太后子；
sentences.literal: next King Heng of Dai, who was installed as Emperor Xiaowen, son of Grand Empress Dowager Bo;
sentences.idiomatic: next was King Heng of Dai, later installed as Emperor Xiaowen, son of Grand Empress Dowager Bo;

sentences.chinese: 次梁王恢，呂太后時徙為趙共王；
sentences.literal: next King Hui of Liang, who in Empress Lü's time was moved to be King Gong of Zhao;
sentences.idiomatic: next was King Hui of Liang, who during Empress Lü's reign was moved to become King Gong of Zhao;

sentences.chinese: 次淮陽王友，呂太后時徙為趙幽王；
sentences.literal: next King You of Huaiyang, who in Empress Lü's time was moved to be King You of Zhao;
sentences.idiomatic: next was King You of Huaiyang, who during Empress Lü's reign was moved to become King You of Zhao;

sentences.literal: next King Li of Huainan, Chang;
sentences.idiomatic: next was King Li of Huainan, Chang;
next was King Jian of Yan.

sentences.literal: The Grand Historian says: The governance of Xia was loyal.
sentences.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: 'The Xia dynasty governed with loyalty.'

sentences.chinese: 忠之敝，小人以野，故殷人承之以敬。
sentences.literal: When loyalty became corrupt, petty men became crude; therefore the Yin people succeeded it with reverence.
sentences.idiomatic: When loyalty decayed, the common people grew uncouth. The Yin dynasty therefore succeeded it with reverence.'

sentences.chinese: 敬之敝，小人以鬼，故周人承之以文。
sentences.literal: When reverence became corrupt, petty men became superstitious; therefore the Zhou people succeeded it with culture.
sentences.idiomatic: When reverence decayed, the common people turned to superstition. The Zhou dynasty therefore succeeded it with ritual.'

sentences.chinese: 文之敝，小人以僿，故救僿莫若以忠。
sentences.literal: When culture becomes corrupt, petty men become deceitful; therefore to rescue deceit nothing is better than loyalty.
sentences.idiomatic: When ritual decayed, the common people became deceitful. To remedy deceit, nothing works better than loyalty.'

sentences.chinese: 三王之道若循環，終而復始。
sentences.literal: The Way of the Three Kings is like a cycle, ending and beginning again.
sentences.idiomatic: The Way of the Three Sovereigns is cyclical, ending only to begin anew.'

sentences.literal: Between Zhou and Qin, it can be said culture had become corrupt.
sentences.idiomatic: Between the Zhou and Qin dynasties, ritual had clearly decayed.'
